Package Engine.Physics

Class CharacterPhysics

java.lang.Object
Engine.Physics.Physics
Engine.Physics.Movement
Engine.Physics.CharacterPhysics
public class CharacterPhysics extends Movement
This class defines methods that help to organise how objects behave in the physics simulation. It is different to the EntityPhysics class as these objects can be moved by the user
Author:
Joshua Dowlman

  • Constructor Details

    • CharacterPhysics

      public CharacterPhysics()
      A blank constructor

    • CharacterPhysics

      public CharacterPhysics(double mass, double xInitialPosition, double yInitialPosition, double xInitialVelocity, double yInitialVelocity, double xInitialAcceleration, double yInitialAcceleration, double xSize, double ySize)
      A constructor that initialises the mass, position, velocity and acceleration of the object
      Parameters:
      mass - a double representing the characters mass
      xInitialPosition - a double representing the initial x position
      yInitialPosition - a double representing the initial y position
      xInitialVelocity - a double representing the initial x velocity
      yInitialVelocity - a double representing the initial y velocity
      xInitialAcceleration - a double representing the initial x acceleration
      yInitialAcceleration - a double representing the initial y acceleration

  • Method Details

    • PushInX

      public void PushInX(double push)
      Uses newtonian equation (F = ma) to update the acceleration in x. The force applied is continuous.
      Parameters:
      push - a double that applies the force to push

    • PushInY

      public void PushInY(double push)
      Uses newtonian equation (F = ma) to update the acceleration in y. The force applied is continuous.
      Parameters:
      push - a double that applies the force to push

    • slowXToZero

      public void slowXToZero(int ticksToStop)
      Changes the acceleration in the x direction to slow the x velocity to 0 in a set amount of time. This only changes the initial acceleration and is vulnerable to changing elsewhere
      Parameters:
      ticksToStop - an integer representing the amount of time to act upon

    • slowYToZero

      public void slowYToZero(int ticksToStop)
      Changes the acceleration in the y direction to slow the y velocity to 0 in a set amount of time. This only changes the initial acceleration and is vulnerable to changing elsewhere
      Parameters:
      ticksToStop - an integer representing the amount of time to act upon

    • Update

      public void Update()
      Updates the current properties of the object. Considers whether the object is being slowed to zero. Calls the UpdatePosition() and UpdateVelocities() method
